result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven P Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven P Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: It is ordered that the time for filing a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended to 30(thirty) days from remittitur in State v. Loomis(2015AP157-CR)
Motion for Extension of Time to File Postconviction Motion or Notice of Appeal

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Plan to seek post conviction relief

Defendant Steven P Miller in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:03 PM. Also called 14CF80. Court has reviewed files and PSI. Bennett asking for the sentencing hearing to be adjourned for stated reasons. State responds - no objection to an adjournment but would like closure soon, victim's mother in Courtroom. Court - has received psychological evalation from defense and also received PSI. Court is prepared to proceed to sentencing and will proceed today. Bennett responds. Discussion on proceeding. Recess to allow time for Bennett to talk to his client as the sentencing will proceed today (2:06 PM). Recalled at 2:42 PM, same appearances. Bennett makes statement on the record regarding the time frame of the filing/preparation of the PSI (stating statute). Court reviews statute and responds. Bennett does not see any factual errors and has no witnesses. State has complied with victim notification requirements and the victim's mother is in the Courtroom and wants to make a statement. Victim's mother makes statement (2:45 PM). State has not received a restitution claim. State does not see any errors or ommissions in the PSI - makes final argument prior to recommendation - on 13CF208 - recommends 10 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES, on 14CF80 - recommends 3 years probation - consecutive to prison term, not eligible for programs due to offense. Bennett makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends 1-2 years in either county jail or prison, generous amount of time on ES, sex offender treatment in the community. Miller makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: Court gives felony rights of no possession of firearms, no voting rights - Court calculates 143 days jail credit - on 13CF208 - $300 fine plus costs - take bond posted, 14CF80 - $300 fine plus costs - take bond posted, conditions of ES will be: employment/school (30 hrs/week with 20 places a month), any program as deemed logical by P&P, comply with sex offender registry, 13CF208 - 7 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES, on 14CF80 - 6 months in prison - consecutive to 13CF208 - with no ES, parties ordered to destroy their PSI's, right to appeal.

Defendant Steven P Miller in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:33 PM. Also called 14CF80. State has provided the Court and Bennett with an Amended Information. Court has plea questionnaire - looks like the defendant is pleading G to count #1 as alleged on the Amended Information and G also to count #1 as alleged on 14CF80. Bennett and State agree. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty. State and Bennett requesting PSI with both parties free to argue. State mentions informing the defendant about sex offender registration. Defendant is aware of that. Court will order a PSI, continues bond on both matters and sets both matters for sentencing hearings. Court dismisses and reads in remaining counts on 13CF208 and gives felony rights. Bennett - wants to address the bond - asking that the bond be modified to allow him to have contact with his brother. State has no objections. Court will modify bond and will remove the no contact provision from his bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
copy of fax from Judge Habeck to counsel
Final pre-trial on February 10, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Called at 1:05 PM. Also called 14CF80. Steven Miller appears in person and his counsel Brian Bennett appears vie telephone from Shawano County. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens via telephone from Shawano County. Judge Habeck appears via video from Shawano County. Bennett - offers have been made to resolve but it is not resolved at this time, asks for STC or JT for stated reasons. Bednar-Clemens has no objections. Court will continue bond on both matters, set this case for FPT on 2/10/15 at 11:15 PM.
Final pre-trial on November 11, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Called at 1:41 PM. Also called 13CF208. Steven Miller appears in person and with counsel Brian Bennett. State appears by Charles Simono. Bennett - waiving PH. Court goes thru verbal waiver of PH collaquey, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Bennett will proceed to ARGN, has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bonds on both cases, set both cases for FPT on 11/11/14 at 1:00 PM.
and certificate of appearance - Sergeant MR

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Called at 9:58 AM. Also called 14CF80. Steven Miller appears in person and with counsel Brian Bennett. State appears by Charles Simono. Bennett - here for AIA on 14CF80, requests PH, will waive time limits. Court continues bond on that matter, considers time limits waived, set for PH on 9/9/14 at 1:30 PM but this is backing up a JT. Court will track this matter as STC on same date and time, continues bond on that matter as well. Bennett indicates to the court that they have received both an offer and discovery on 13CF208.
Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven P Miller in court and without counsel.  Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:32 am. Court advises of charges/penalties and right to attorney and court appoint attorney. State makes statement regarding attorney SPD appointment on his other case (Bennett). Defendant has contacted SPD and wants attorney  Bennett to be appointed to this case. Court will have case assigned to Judge Haback and he will be notified of another date. Bond continued. JA informed about appointing Judge Haback to this case as well.
